title: Could Brian Thomas Jr. be a legitimate trade target for Patriots this offseason?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Brian Thomas Jr. had 1,200 receiving yards in his first season with the Jaguars and could interest the Patriots.
The Patriots need to improve their offense for QB Drake Maye; Brian Thomas Jr. might be a potential trade target.
Thomas's performance declined in 2025; Jaguars might consider trading him to recoup draft assets lost in other trades.

title: 3 takeaways from Team USA men’s hockey’s OT win over Sweden in Olympics
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Quinn Hughes scored in overtime to secure a 2-1 victory for Team USA over Sweden, advancing them to the semifinals.
Dylan Larkin also scored for Team USA, while Mika Zibanejad netted Sweden's only goal, tying the game with 1:31 left.
Team USA will face Slovakia in the semifinals; Canada will play Finland in the other semifinal match.

title: Pittsfield armored vehicle company is largest ICE contract in Mass.
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Lenco Industries in Pittsfield secured $5.2 million in ICE contracts for BearCat armored vehicles over the past year.
Governor Maura Healey urges companies to avoid ICE contracts, but Lenco's deals have largely avoided public scrutiny.
Lenco previously applied for state grants to increase production and also contracts with fire departments and military.

title: Former State Police union head, lobbyist get more prison time for fraud, racketeering
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Dana Pullman, ex-union president, sentenced to two years for racketeering, fraud, and tax crimes; ordered to pay $43,915 restitution.
Anne Lynch, former lobbyist, sentenced to 15 months for her role; ordered to pay $41,795 restitution in a corruption scheme.
Pullman and Lynch's convictions included wire fraud, obstruction of justice, and misusing State Police Association funds.

title: Boston 25 News head meteorologist Kevin Lemanowicz departing after 3 decades with the station
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Kevin Lemanowicz is stepping down as chief meteorologist from Boston 25 News at the end of February.
Lemanowicz has been with Boston 25 News since its inception in 1996, serving nearly 30 years.
He has reported on major weather events, including Massachusetts' 2011 tornadoes and 2023 Leominster flooding.

title: Red Sox release statement after outcry over flawed jersey design
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox fans criticized the 2026 home jerseys due to overlapping lettering and stripe design flaws.
The team will adjust the jersey design before the April 3 home opener against the San Diego Padres.
The Red Sox stated Fanatics met specifications, and praised them for timely production of corrected jerseys.

title: Pawtucket police find firearms in ice rink shooter’s storage locker, identify ‘courageous citizens’ who intervened
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Pawtucket police found firearms and accessories in Robert Dorgan's storage unit and traced guns from ice rink shooting to him.
Robert Dorgan killed his ex-wife and son at Pawtucket's Dennis M. Lynch Arena, prompting investigation in Maine and Rhode Island.
Citizens subdued the shooter and provided first aid; three surviving victims remain critically injured in the hospital.

title: MBTA announces service changes and suspensions for March
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: MBTA announces weekend service suspensions for Orange Line and four Commuter Rail lines in March for signal upgrades.
Shuttle buses will replace Orange Line service from Back Bay to Forest Hills, and Commuter Rail lines to North Station.
MBTA advises passengers to add extra travel time for shuttles; upto 70 minutes for certain lines and connections.

title: Rafael Devers reacts to Red Sox exec’s ‘pick up a glove’ comment
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Rafael Devers addresses comments made by Red Sox chairman Tom Werner about his reluctance to switch positions.
Devers was traded to the San Francisco Giants in June 2025 after disputes over playing positions with the Red Sox.
Despite position changes, Devers hit .236 with 20 home runs for the Giants in 90 games last season.

title: Adam Schefter maps out potential price for Patriots in Maxx Crosby trade
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots could trade for Raiders' Maxx Crosby, but price could be high, according to ESPN's Adam Schefter.
Maxx Crosby's discontent with Raiders involves decisions by Alex Guerrero, affecting his trade potential.
Patriots' 2026 first-round pick may be in play due to team's low sack rankings last season.
